{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2957272,"name":"Evan Branson","username":"TzarBuilds","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/258eb7/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-06-07T22:32:52.210Z","cooked":"

Chassis1185√ó1009 844 KB

Hello everyone,

I just designed this chassis as an offseason project. Based on what you all can see, would this be effective in competition (IE not get eviscerated by a defense bot)? I understand the aspect that geometry plays into this (parts with 3D geometry are stronger than 2D plates), but I feel like I‚Äôve done a reasonable job placing standoffs and brackets to counteract this problem. If there‚Äôs any good way to test this in SolidWorks, I would love to know.

Would love to see some feedback. Thanks everyone.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":74,"updated_at":"2021-06-07T22:32:52.210Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":50,"reads":617,"readers_count":616,"score":453.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":394472,"topic_slug":"hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design","display_username":"Evan Branson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/2/6/26487b1c006097a29a411e2a41756aabe718b64a.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":43288,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design/394472/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2957298,"name":"UnofficialForth","username":"UnofficialForth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/unofficialforth/{size}/167902_2.png","created_at":"2021-06-07T23:23:23.813Z","cooked":"

Hi! I‚Äôm not sure this is what you meant but I feel like it should be asked:

Can you defend your choice as to why this custom drive over a kitbot chassis?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":74,"updated_at":"2021-06-07T23:23:23.813Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":565,"readers_count":564,"score":258.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":394472,"topic_slug":"hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design","display_username":"UnofficialForth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29982,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC Team 4272 Mentor | World's FLL Emcee"},"post_url":"/t/hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design/394472/2","custom_user_title":"FRC Team 4272 Mentor | World's FLL Emcee","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":9}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2957299,"name":"Evan Branson","username":"TzarBuilds","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/258eb7/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-06-07T23:30:30.559Z","cooked":"

Our programmers didn‚Äôt like the dropped center wheel of the KOP during autonomous.

This was also supposed to be a fun project for the team to do that goes a little bit outside the box of what we are normally able to make so doing things custom seemed like a good idea.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":74,"updated_at":"2021-06-07T23:30:30.559Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":557,"readers_count":556,"score":166.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":394472,"topic_slug":"hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design","display_username":"Evan Branson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":29982,"username":"UnofficialForth","name":"UnofficialForth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/unofficialforth/{size}/167902_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":43288,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design/394472/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2957302,"name":"Caleb Jackson","username":"csj1232","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/csj1232/{size}/154808_2.png","created_at":"2021-06-07T23:40:16.425Z","cooked":"
TzarBuilds:

Our programmers didn‚Äôt like the dropped center wheel of the KOP during autonomous.

Unfortunately, this is a problem you will simply have to deal with. The drop-center is integral to having a robot that can drive properly, as it eliminates wheel ‚Äúscrub‚Äù from the corner wheels. Center drop can be reduced by using omni-wheels on the corners, but a robot with perfectly in-line wheels(even omni wheels) will have a very hard time turning, which will make autonomous even harder.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":74,"updated_at":"2021-06-07T23:41:02.428Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":535,"readers_count":534,"score":207.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":394472,"topic_slug":"hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design","display_username":"Caleb Jackson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44772,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"TubeTragic: Inventor, Founder, CEO"},"post_url":"/t/hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design/394472/4","custom_user_title":"TubeTragic: Inventor, Founder, CEO","reactions":[{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":12},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":17,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2957303,"name":"Evan Branson","username":"TzarBuilds","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/258eb7/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-06-07T23:41:33.076Z","cooked":"

Fair enough. Thank you for the input.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":74,"updated_at":"2021-06-07T23:41:33.076Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":504,"readers_count":503,"score":110.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":394472,"topic_slug":"hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design","display_username":"Evan Branson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":44772,"username":"csj1232","name":"Caleb Jackson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/csj1232/{size}/154808_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":43288,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design/394472/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2957304,"name":"Caleb Jackson","username":"csj1232","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/csj1232/{size}/154808_2.png","created_at":"2021-06-07T23:43:33.110Z","cooked":"

I will also add that a center drop does add a slight ‚Äúsuspension‚Äù to the drive. For example, in the 2020/21 game, where there were 1‚Äù bumps in the field, if you have no drop, when you hit the barriers, the front 2 wheels will immediately pop up at the same time, giving only your back wheel a chance to push the whole robot. With a center drop, when the robot hits the bump, it will rock back on the rear 2 wheels and give slightly more pushing power to clear the bump smoothly.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":74,"updated_at":"2021-06-07T23:43:33.110Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":495,"readers_count":494,"score":119.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":394472,"topic_slug":"hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design","display_username":"Caleb Jackson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":43288,"username":"TzarBuilds","name":"Evan Branson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/258eb7/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44772,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"TubeTragic: Inventor, Founder, CEO"},"post_url":"/t/hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design/394472/6","custom_user_title":"TubeTragic: Inventor, Founder, CEO","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"hugs","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2957306,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2021-06-07T23:46:42.675Z","cooked":"
csj1232:

but a robot with perfectly in-line wheels(even omni wheels) will have a very hard time turning, which will make autonomous even harder.

This is false. You can run a 4WD with omni-wheels and turn just fine; why do you think a 6WD with omni wheels would require a center drop?

OP: Your design looks fine, though most of the important constraints have little to do with how the drive performs and a lot to do with how easy it is to build, and it‚Äôs hard to judge that without knowing how you intend to manufacture this.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":74,"updated_at":"2021-06-07T23:49:39.457Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":484,"readers_count":483,"score":391.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":394472,"topic_slug":"hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":19}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design/394472/7","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":19}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":19,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2957307,"name":"","username":"heatblast016","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/heatblast016/{size}/160472_2.png","created_at":"2021-06-07T23:52:09.884Z","cooked":"
Oblarg:

This is false. You can run a 4WD with omni-wheels and turn just fine; why do you think a 6WD with omni wheels would require a center drop?

A 6wd with omnis needs a slight center drop to make sure that the center wheels are actually in contact so you maintain traction (iirc 254 did 1/16 in 2018)

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":74,"updated_at":"2021-06-07T23:52:09.884Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":467,"readers_count":466,"score":168.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":394472,"topic_slug":"hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32113,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design/394472/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2957309,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2021-06-07T23:53:35.614Z","cooked":"

That depends specifically on your choice of wheels; you‚Äôll have to nudge the center up or down to account for differences in the effective diameter of the wheels, since it‚Äôs extremely hard to source an omni-wheel and a traction wheel with identical diameters.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":74,"updated_at":"2021-06-07T23:53:42.240Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":452,"readers_count":451,"score":175.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":394472,"topic_slug":"hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":32113,"username":"heatblast016","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/heatblast016/{size}/160472_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design/394472/9","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2957310,"name":"","username":"heatblast016","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/heatblast016/{size}/160472_2.png","created_at":"2021-06-07T23:54:33.614Z","cooked":"

Yeah, but generally speaking you‚Äôll end up needing to have the bottom of your center wheel slightly lower than your corner wheels, otherwise it isn‚Äôt guaranteed to be in contact

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":74,"updated_at":"2021-06-07T23:54:33.614Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":438,"readers_count":437,"score":127.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":394472,"topic_slug":"hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32113,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design/394472/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2957311,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2021-06-07T23:56:12.578Z","cooked":"

‚ÄúContact‚Äù here isn‚Äôt really a dichotomous thing. The real question is, ‚Äúhow much do you want to load the center wheel relative to the outer wheels?‚Äù This depends on your design goals.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":74,"updated_at":"2021-06-07T23:56:12.578Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":429,"readers_count":428,"score":170.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":394472,"topic_slug":"hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":32113,"username":"heatblast016","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/heatblast016/{size}/160472_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design/394472/11","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2957314,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2021-06-08T00:03:53.826Z","cooked":"

It is very kop-like, but missing the features of having bends in the plates, which do impart a lot to the strength of that design. If you have the ability to make long sheet metal bends that‚Äôd be an improvement.

could you provide an example where loading the outer wheels would be better then the center ones that makes a significant difference to justify not having a drop?

why is that your default? if this was all theoretical then i would get it but we live in a world where machining isn‚Äôt perfect. floors defiantly aren‚Äôt perfect and you would assume that there‚Äôs no other obstacles you would have to drive over which most games have.

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":74,"updated_at":"2021-06-08T00:08:11.610Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":14,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":411,"readers_count":410,"score":87.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":394472,"topic_slug":"hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":47788,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"worm kid"},"post_url":"/t/hot-take-on-my-drivetrain-design/394472/15","custom_user_title":"worm kid","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2957318,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2021-06-08T00:09:23.441Z","cooked":"

Because equal loading means equal wear and a decreased risk of failure.

This isn‚Äôt a decision that can be made in the abstract. What, particularly, do you need the robot to do? What does that say about weighting the wheels? Decide that, and then figure out what amount of center adjustment is necessary to achieve it.

OP, I like the drivetrain. My only issue is with all the L-brackets, which are always kind of finicky to get to fit tightly. You might want to look into tab-and-slot connections to make sure everything fits well. @Allison_K might have some pictures of fitting a captive nut into into a tab and slot design, which is cool.

This could be a minor complaint, but if you look at this design from the top, it‚Äôs made of rectangles. Rectangles are easy to make, but not particularly rigid. The bellypan is doing some good work to keep the big center rectangle in shape, but the outer rectangles that make up the wheel wells aren‚Äôt all that well supported, and might be susceptible to deforming like this:

image586√ó577 2.88 KB

If you attach those two plates with a flat plane (tab & slot attachment?), you can keep that assembly as rigid as the center part is. (As a bonus, it‚Äôll also help to fix @ngreen‚Äôs concern with the sheet metal bends).

image586√ó577 2.99 KB

@oblarg and Co, this conversation is technically interesting, but only tangentially relevant to OP‚Äôs drivetrain. Maybe bring it to a new thread?

TzarBuilds:

Our programmers didn‚Äôt like the dropped center wheel of the KOP during autonomous.

Understandable. I‚Äôve also seen some teams use a lathe to mill down the center wheel. This makes it smaller than the outer ones, effectively eliminating the drop. This might serve as a cheaper option.
(Or at least a prototyping alternative to see if you like no-drop before committing)
